title: Jude Bellingham favourite to win Euro 2024 award after Serbia winner
body_text:
Jude Bellingham favourite to win Euro 2024 award after Serbia winner
Jude Bellingham was the stand out player for England in their opening match against Serbia and the bookies have reacted
After his impressive display for England against Serbia, Jude Bellingham has leapfrogged his to become the favourite for Euro 2024's Player of the Tournament. The Real Madrid midfielder showed no signs of tiredness having reported to international duty just weeks after lifting the Champions League trophy with Carlo Ancelotti at Wembley Stadium when he headed in England's match winner in their opening group match.
He has been tipped to be one of the star players in the build up to the tournament and the England man was third in the betting at 10/1 with William Hill to scoop the accolade pre-competition but has been backed into 6/1 following his winning goal against Serbia in England’s opening Group C fixture on Sunday night.
Those odds see him climb above Kylian Mbappe (13/2) and Harry Kane (12/1) in the market – the latter drifting from 10/1 after a quiet start to the tournament – while Germany’s Toni Kroos (14/1) has also attracted early support.
William Hill's spokesperson Lee Phelps said: “Jude Bellingham really ran the show in Gelsenkirchen last night in an otherwise underwhelming England display, and his performance has seen him climb to the summit of our Player of the Tournament market.
“The Real Madrid star was already among the frontrunners at 10/1 for the award but is now the outright favourite at 6/1 to take home the accolade, seeing him move above England teammate Harry Kane and previous favourite Kylian Mbappe.”
